title: Initial Complaint
description: Palm Beach Police Department receives the first formal complaint against Jeffrey Epstein from parent of a minor victim.

title: Florida Grand Jury Indictment
description: Epstein is indicted by a Florida grand jury on one count of soliciting prostitution.

title: Non-Prosecution Agreement
description: The controversial NPA is signed by U.S. Attorney Alexander Acosta, allowing Epstein to plead guilty to state charges in exchange for federal immunity.

title: Federal Arrest
description: Epstein is arrested at Teterboro Airport by the FBI and NYPD on charges of sex trafficking and conspiracy.

title: SDNY Search Warrant
description: Federal agents execute search warrants at Epstein's Manhattan residence, recovering thousands of photos and digital media.

title: Death in Custody
description: Jeffrey Epstein is found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell Arrest
description: FBI agents arrest Ghislaine Maxwell in Bradford, New Hampshire, on charges of enticement and sex trafficking.

title: Maxwell Conviction
description: A federal jury finds Ghislaine Maxwell guilty on five of six counts including sex trafficking of a minor.

title: Giuffre v. Maxwell Unsealing
description: Judge Loretta Preska unseals hundreds of documents and names associated with the settled civil case.

title: Major Transparency Act Release
description: DOJ releases 18,550 files including USVI productions and previously redacted evidence logs.
